alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Elliott; Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan; Pike; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, east central Morgan, Johnson, northern Floyd, northern Breathitt, northwestern Pike, Magoffin, southeastern Wolfe and southeastern Elliott Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 926 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Webbville to Blaine to Ballot to near Keck. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Barnetts Creek, Denver, Fitz, Staffordsville, Patrick, Leander, Dobson, Swamp Branch, Chandlerville and Winifred around 930 PM EDT. Paintsville, Thealka, Thelma, Woodland Estates, Perston Estates, Tutor Key, Hagerhill, Bobbs, West Van Lear and Buffalo around 935 PM EDT. Salyersville, Mason, Carver, Wells Chapel, Boons Camp, Conley Station, Carver Station, Swampton, Sublett and Royalton around 940 PM EDT. Gypsy, Tomahawk, Pevier, Stidham, Brainard, Debord, Davisport, Marshallville, Gapville and Delong around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Inez, Bonanza, Dotson, Andy, Beauty, Lovely, Bradbury, Calf Creek, Blue River, Dock, Prestonsburg, Warfield, Allen, Bays Branch, Hode, Lancer, Cliff, Auxier, Corn Fork Hollow, Nero, Dicks Creek, Endicott, Odds, Pleasant, McCombs and Moree. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 68 and 76. Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 9. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 9 and 14. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 4 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Elliott; Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Morgan; Pike; Wolfe
